item.title: JD.com Falls as Sales Volume Slows With China Growth Concern (1)
item.author: Bonnie Cao
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- JD.com Inc., China’s second-biggest online retailer, plunged after it reported flagging sales growth on its marketplaces and management expressed concern about the country’s economic slowdown.
item.media:description: (Bloomberg) -- JD.com Inc., China’s second-biggest online retailer, plunged after it reported flagging sales growth on its marketplaces and management expressed concern about the country’s economic slowdown.

item.title: Brazil Markets Thrown Into Disarray as Impeachment Vote Annulled
item.author: Filipe Pacheco and Paula Sambo
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- Brazilian markets were thrown into turmoil after the effort to impeach President Dilma Rousseff appeared to hit a roadblock, spurring concern that some of the world’s biggest stock and currency rallies would be undone.
item.media:description: (Bloomberg) -- Brazilian markets were thrown into turmoil after the effort to impeach President Dilma Rousseff appeared to hit a roadblock, spurring concern that some of the world’s biggest stock and currency rallies would be undone.
